p:
We used a population of 100,000 people, slightly smaller than the total population of Caguas and larger than the population of the area covered by mosquito surveillance. The total number of mosquitoes, N
M , was estimated from the density of Ae. aegypti ( r) and human population size. We assumed there were 1 to 3 adult female Ae. aegypti per person, which we assumed to be gamma distributed [ 19â€“ 21].
